summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutors discussing a draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails show the collaborative revision process, scheduling of calls, and circulation of the draft document.

events.title: Draft Maxwell Indictment Revision
events.description: A revised draft of the Ghislaine Maxwell indictment is circulated, adding additional details and addressing prior comments.

events.title: Call Scheduled to Discuss Indictment
events.description: A call is scheduled to discuss the 'over acts' question in the draft Maxwell indictment.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell indictment.
A revised draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell was circulated on or before June 17, 2020, with tracked changes.
Prosecutors were actively collaborating on the indictment's details, including a specific discussion point regarding 'over acts'.
All personal names of prosecutors and staff in the email chain are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
The correspondence shows the indictment was in advanced draft stages in mid-June 2020, shortly before Maxwell's arrest on July 2, 2020.
